page.title: 17THE SEWAGE WORKS, LINCOLN.
page.content: The {Canwick sewage works} dispose of {4,000,000 gallons} of sewage a day, {12,000,000}in wet weather. The sewage comes from toilets, baths, washing machines etc. It is pumped into the first {settlement tanks}and, after all rubbish and grit have been removed, passes on to the next tanks which are {13m. deep }at the centre. The solids now sink to the bottom and the liquid continues on to the filter beds where oxygen aids a natural breakdown. After {18 hours}the liquid sewage reaches the {humus tanks.}From there it is returned to the river. The {sludge}is pumped inside to the filter presses which compact it by a chemical process and turn it into{" cake "}which is then collected by farmers for fertiliser. The sewage plant is now controlled by {two computers. 3 emergency generators are available should the supply fail.
